meanings.def: the period of time when somebody holds an important job, especially a political one; the act of holding an important job
examples: She had a long tenure of office.

meanings.def: the right to stay permanently in your job, especially as a teacher at a university
examples: It's still extremely difficult to get tenure.
She has been granted tenure at Leeds University.

meanings.def: the legal right to live in a house or use a piece of land
examples: When you rent a house here, you don’t have security of tenure.
